It is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and clusters of fragrant, pale pink or white flowers. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India and Sri Lanka, and thrives in moist, tropical environments. It often grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The flowers are primarily visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
